        public HostMonitorConfig setBroadcastAction(String broadcastAction)
        Set the broadcast action string to use when broadcasting host status changes
        Parameters:
        broadcastAction - (e.g.: com.example.yourapp.hoststatus)
        Returns:
        HostMonitorConfig

      • getBroadcastAction

        public String getBroadcastAction()
        Gets the broadcast action used for host status changes.
        Returns:
        the configured broadcast action string

      • add

        public HostMonitorConfig add(String host,
                             int port)
        Adds a new host to be monitored. The change will be applied starting from the next reachability scan.
        Parameters:
        host - host IP address or FQDN
        port - TCP port to check
        Returns:
        HostMonitorConfig

      • remove

        public HostMonitorConfig remove(String host,
                                int port)
        Remove a monitored host. The change will be applied starting from the next reachability scan.
        Parameters:
        host - host address to check
        port - tcp port to check
        Returns:
        HostMonitorConfig

      • removeAll

        public HostMonitorConfig removeAll()
        Remove all the monitored hosts.
        Returns:
        HostMonitorConfig

      • setSocketTimeoutInSeconds

        public HostMonitorConfig setSocketTimeoutInSeconds(int seconds)
        Set socket connection timeout in seconds.
        Parameters:
        seconds - maximum number of seconds to wait for a socket connection to be established
        Returns:
        HostMonitorConfig

      • setSocketTimeoutInMilliseconds

        public HostMonitorConfig setSocketTimeoutInMilliseconds(int millisecs)
        Set socket connection timeout in milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        millisecs - maximum number of seconds to wait for a socket connection to be established
        Returns:
        HostMonitorConfig

      • getSocketTimeout

        public int getSocketTimeout()
        Get socket timeout in milliseconds. By default is 2000.
        Returns:
        the configured socket timeout

      • setCheckIntervalInSeconds

        public HostMonitorConfig setCheckIntervalInSeconds(int seconds)
        Set check interval in seconds. 0 means that check interval is disabled (it's the default value).
        Parameters:
        seconds - how often to check for hosts reachability
        Returns:
        HostMonitorConfig

      • setCheckIntervalInMinutes

        public HostMonitorConfig setCheckIntervalInMinutes(int minutes)
        Set check interval in minutes. 0 means that check interval is disabled (it's the default value).
        Parameters:
        minutes - how often to check for hosts reachability
        Returns:
        HostMonitorConfig

      • getCheckInterval

        public int getCheckInterval()
        Get check interval in milliseconds. By default is zero, so no periodic check is performed until you set it.
        Returns:
        the configured check interval in milliseconds

      • setMaxAttempts

        public HostMonitorConfig setMaxAttempts(int maxAttempts)
        Sets the maximum number of socket connections to perform before notifying that the port is unreachable.
        Parameters:
        maxAttempts - maximum number of connections to try (must be at least 1)
        Returns:
        HostMonitorConfig

      • getMaxAttempts

        public int getMaxAttempts()
        Gets the maximum number of socket connections to perform before notifying that the port is unreachable. Default value is 3.
        Returns:
        number of attempts

      • reset

        public static void reset(Context context)
        Resets the currently persisted configuration. Disables the connectivity receiver and cancels all scheduled periodic checks (if any).
        Parameters:
        context - application context

      • save

        public void save()
        Saves and applies the configuration changes. If there aren't configured hosts, it disables the ConnectivityReceiver and cancels scheduled period checks. If there is at least one configured host, it enables the ConnectivityReceiver and re-schedules periodic checks with new settings. If periodic check interval is set to zero, host reachability checks will be triggered only when the connectivity status of the device changes.
